response.answer_text: Considering the prerequisite of 5 years experience in the IT Security industry you will have skills in some of the domains covered by CISSP. For example if you have been on the operational side such as a firewall administrator or a security analyst your skills are probably very strong in the technical aspects. However, you may never have dealt with policy, compliance or risk management. My advice is to focus on the CISSP domains that you are weakest in. For me I was weak in encryption so having a developers background I built a password vault system that used encryption to store the passwords “at rest”. This enabled me to better understand how encryption works. If firewalls and networking are a weak point then grab an old computer and install Sophos UTM free edition for home use, set that up at home and add some firewall rules, configure a VPN etc…. The great thing about the Sophos UTM for home is that its a full enterprise-level firewall - with all the features free for home use. If your weakness is on policy, compliance and risk then offer to update the security policy of your business or just review and provide recommendations on what should be included etc… I guess what I am saying is “doing” is better than trying to absorb all you need to learn just reading about it. Of course you still need to study all the CISSP domains in the study guide to ensure you understand what they consider important. Finally, the best study guide for me was James M. Stewart, Mike Chapple and Darril Gibson - CISSP Study Guide (the one with the light house on the cover) - easy to read and digest. I found Shon Harris far too detailed and the sarcastic remarks at the beginning of each chapter annoying and childish.

How difficult is CISSP? CISSP is an advanced level information security certification and the CISSP aspirants can ascertain its difficulty level by themselves because it depends on their preparation and hands-on practice. Those who have a clear plan on how to manage their entire CISSP project will find it as the easiest way to boost their career in the information security industry. On the other hand, those who have a pre-set of expectations with no clear goals or plan will eventually end up losing their money and time both. However, keep in mind that CISSP is a difficult job which requires a lot of hard work, dedication, and passion to succeed. If you are an IT professional and you have a passion for doing something new for your career, then this CISSP can be the best option for you. The reason being CISSP the right choice is because this certification is awarded by a vendor-neutral non-profit organization which purpose is to design policies and guidelines for information security, to secure possible data breaches. A CISSP certified professional is competent enough to design, engineer, implement and manage information security system through the entire organization. They are also responsible for securing the critical assets from being hacked by other companies. CISSP is recognized worldwide, so the importance of having a CISSP certification cannot be ignored if you are already working in an information security industry. In order to overcome the difficulty of the CISSP exam preparation, the individual should have to go through the CBK and assess their personal abilities like weaknesses as well as the strengths. The weaknesses then should be reviewed and supplemented either through getting hands-on practice or by accessing other resources like tutors, books, guides, and practice exams question answers. Once the physical assessment is made, then the individual should plan for their entire course work. They should plan it properly; write down the timeline which indicates the schedule for the whole CISSP project. The individual should consider options to manage the learning task while handling the job role activities. In many cases, the employers, bosses, and peers extend their full support to those who are preparing for their certification exams. So, the individuals can check from their relevant department heads if they are allowed for any relaxations while studying for the CISSP exam. Right after proper planning for the entire course, the next step to overcome the CISSP exam difficulty is to take know-how about the exam. It includes knowing the basic structure and content of the exam. There are many certified individuals who recommend checking exam guidelines because it helps to boost self-confidence. The CISSP exam consists of around 250 multiple choice questions, it lasts for around three hours in the English version and six hours’ time is given for non-English exam. The domains tested in this exam are eight: 1. Security and Risk Management 2. Asset Security 3. Security Architecture and Engineering 4. Communication and Network Security 5. Identity and Access Management 6. Security Assessment and Testing 7. Security Operations 8. Software Development Security There are several ways to prepare the exam like reading the books, watching online tutorials, joining boot camps and getting enrolled in authorized study centers. These study centers have certified trained professionals who can assist the candidates to learn the logic and get hands-on practice by practicing the learning stuff in a real-time lab environment. Adding up few guides related to CISSP training can also be a good supplement in learning foundations and memorizing them. Some CISSP certified professionals also recommend purchasing practice paper for reputed vendors, solving them in a routine and reviewing them in order to get good hands-on practice. This can also be helpful in covering maximum topics in a short time frame. Apart from all these healthy tips, the willingness of the individual counts a lot in passing the CISSP CAT 100 - 150 English or 100 - 250 non-English exams.
